info.description:
controling outline thickness  as minimal 1pixel thick vs given pixel width vs %scale.
( compare at various resolutions )
info.name: outline of sdf

renderpass.code:
#define S(v) clamp(1. - (v)/scale, 0., 1. )  // Antialiased draw
//#define S(v) smoothstep(1.5*scale, 0., v  )  // Note that these are assymetrical:
                                               // it's usually a bad idea, but here an abs() is expected in v 

void mainImage( out vec4 O, vec2 u )
{
    vec2 R = iResolution.xy,
         U = ( 2.*u - R ) / R.y;               // centred - normalize coordinates. Vertical = [-1,1]
    float scale = 2./R.y,                      // pixel width
            sdf = min( length(U)-.3 ,          // disk1 UNIONÂ disk2
                       length(U+.2+.2*sin(iTime) ) - .3);
    O = vec4( S(sdf) );                        // antialiased drawing of main shape
    O.r +=  S ( abs(sdf-.1) );                 // 1pix thick outline offsetted by 10% of unit scale.
    O.g +=  S ( abs(sdf-.3) -.05 );            // 5% of unit scale thick outline 
    O.b +=  S ( abs(sdf-.5) -4.*scale );       // 4 pixel outline 
    
    O = pow( O, vec4(1./2.2) );                // to sRGB
}
